boardgame.name: Vabanque
바방크
boardgame.description: A party meets for a game in the casino. After the players determine how much money can be won at the casino tables they play their character cards and move their pawns to a casino table. The payout can be multiplied or lost to card sharks. In the beginning the stakes are low but they increase from round to round. In Vabanque, if you carefully watch the others, and guess their bluffs, you can win a lot. The player with the most money after four rounds is the winner.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2002 Japan Boardgame Prize Best Foreign Game for Beginners Nominee
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: 보톡스(Boardgame Talks) 제27회 - Francis Tresham, Caylus Magna Carta, Cavum, Vabanque

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.comment: Played this once, and it was -- strange. I won the game, but it seemed purely a matter of luck. Will need to play this some more before deciding on a rating.

Purchased from Troll and Toad

Bruno Faidutti and Leo Colvini; A party meets for a game in the casino. After the players determine how much money can be won at the casino tables they play their character cards and move their pawns to a casino table. The payout can be multiplied or lost to card sharks. In the beginning the stakes are low but they increase from round to round. If you carefully watch the others, and guess their bluffs, you can win a lot.

Note, ScubaPA wrote, "I wrote to Bruno Faidutti and he was kind enough to reply and said that indeed character cards can be played on more than one table as the rules imply but don't state specifically."

Bluffing/Bidding Party-style game. Tom Vasel loves it...but it didn't look like something I'd get to the table much. Would rather play Vegas Dice Game(aka Las Vegas) with a similar theme at this player count.

Tom Vasel all time fav
What a truly awful game. No meaningful decisions to be made, no enjoyment to be had.

Too easy to fall behind with no chance of catching up, and even if you do keep pace (or lead), the big money final round will determine the winner, regardless, making most of your earlier moves kind of pointless. And since the last round has a good deal of randomness to it, the whole game is kind of pointless.

Played a few times on BSW (with 3-4 players). This game probably has something more than pure, random guessing. Too bad I could not find it yet. Still, as it is short enough and on BSW, I might try it again some day.

Interesting but kind of strange game. After playing it a couple of times, it seems that the only thing that matters is doing well in the last round or so. This makes one wonder why the earlier rounds exist at all...
Just didn't work for me
don't plan. do whatever you want without thinking and see who wins

disappointed. the box is a nice size, the bits are absolutely excellent. i'm not sure why english rules weren't included with the game, but they're available on bgg and very simple. the game escalates up 4 rounds of betting and bluffing. it doesn't seem like the earlier rounds matter at all barring a bizarrely excessive payout, and the whole game feels like hoity toity with less content. i would have never predicted saying that about a game. i know they're targeting light and fun, but it was more like we had fun in spite of the game. i do love the rule about changing seats for turn order, though.
both bad and forgettable
Vasel rec'd. Pretty terrible at 3p. I'd like to try this again with more.
wow... pretty bad bluffing game
Complete randomness. Utter frustration.
I really want to like this, and at some level I think I do, but every time I play it everyone else despises it so, I doubt I'll bring it out often because I don't want to inflict this on others.
Even though I like some other games that are mostly about group-think (e.g.Hol's der Geier family), this one didn't appeal beyond the nice bits.
Played this on BSW a few times but never got into it. Another paper/rock/scissors type game that seems even more random then most. This one just isn't my thing.
A light and silly bluffing game. For me it doesn't quite work, because there's just not information on which to guess what your opponent might be up to, so it ends up seeming like dumb luck.
reviewed on my blog.
Not bad, but the blind-bidding/groupthink guesswork is just not my idea of great gaming.
Great components... just so-so bluffing game.

[Colovini / Faidutti] Easy to explain, gorgeous bits, actual tension, and handles up to six with ease. It is entirely too much about groupthink though. Playing with bluffers would be much more interesting than playing with logical players, which is unfortunately my entire group.
Components are nice. Not much game here.

Another blind guessing game (in the same vein as Basari or Hoity Toity) that I just don't enjoy. If you like bluffing games then give this a try, but if you're like me and find bluffing games more like completely random games (along the lines of Candy Land or Chutes & Ladders) then you can skip this one and count yourself lucky.
Pure bluffing game with no extra elements or twists to make the game more interesting.

Players seed different tables with money, then each player plays a cheat card, a doubler card and a bluff card face down across different tables. And here's the skillful part ... you try and guess where opponent's didn't play their cheat cards and move to that table (otherwise they'll get your money) AND you try and guess where opponents would like to go and place your cheat card there (so you'll get their money), hoping opponents will think it's your bluff card. Oh, what skill, what fun! Repeat for 4 rounds, with each round having more money so that the early rounds are fairly meaningless. As you can gather, not my kind of game. It's kind of fun seeing the cards revealed and whether you guessed right or not, but there's not much else pulling me back.
Too much Vizzini effect
Fun but nothing more. I have other bluffing/push-your-luck games I'd rather play.
It's supposed to be a bluffing game, but I find the mechanics too difficult for that.
Just a game, not exciting nor especially amusing.
The end is random. If you love a little bit control who wins the game then don´t play the game.
The last round has huge impact and why bother playing the first 3 rounds?

Excellent components...except for the cards: they're weird. Not a bad game, to be sure, but I'd rather play any number of bluffing games for the time investment.

After one play: elegant idea and quick gameplay (something I like). It seems that much depends on the players - have to test it a few times more.
